intro: Leontodon rigens, commonly known as the rigid hawk’s-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. The rigid hawk’s-beard is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
